TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Exec extends Microsoft.Build.Tasks.ToolTaskExtension

Docs.summary: This class defines an "Exec" MSBuild task, which simply invokes the specified process with the specified arguments, waits for it to complete, and then returns True if the process completed successfully, and False if an error occurred.

Docs.summary: Returns the output as an Item. Whitespace are trimmed. ConsoleOutput is enabled when ConsoleToMSBuild is true. This avoids holding lines in memory if they aren't used. ConsoleOutput is a combination of stdout and stderr.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ConsoleToMSBuild { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.ConsoleToMSBuild : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Enable the pipe of the standard out to an item (StandardOutput).
Docs.Remarks: Even thought this is called a pipe, it is in fact a Tee. Use StandardOutputImportance to adjust the visibility of the stdout.

Docs.param: The path to the tool to execute.
Command line arguments that should go into a temporary response file.
Command line arguments that should be passed to the tool directly.
Docs.summary: Executes cmd.exe and waits for it to complete
Docs.returns: Upon completion of the process, returns True if successful, False if not.
Docs.remarks: Overridden to clean up the batch file afterwards.

Protected Overrides Function GetWorkingDirectory () As String

Docs.summary: Gets the working directory to use for the process. Should return null if ToolTask should use the current directory. May throw an IOException if the directory to be used is somehow invalid.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the working directory is UNC, returns the system path %SystemRoot%\System32.

Protected Overrides Function HandleTaskExecutionErrors () As Boolean

Docs.summary: Allows tool to handle the return code. This method will only be called with non-zero exitCode set to true.
Docs.returns: if exit code was ignored; otherwise, .
Docs.remarks: Overridden to make sure we display the command we put in the batch file, not the cmd.exe command used to run the batch file.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether the Exec task should ignore the exit code provided by the executed command () or should return if the executed command returns a non-zero exit code ().

Docs.summary: Whether to use pick out lines in the output that match the standard error/warning format, and log them as errors/warnings. Defaults to false.
Docs.value: if the Exec task should ignore the standard error and warning format and should log errors and warnings as regular messages; if the Exec task should log the errors and warnings that match the standard error and warning format.

Docs.param: Single line from the output to parse.
The importance to log the message with.
Docs.summary: Calls a method on the TaskLoggingHelper to parse a single line of text to see if there are any errors or warnings in canonical format.
Docs.remarks: Overridden to handle any custom regular expressions supplied.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the output items from the task.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `Exec` task does not set the output items. Instead, you can provide the output items as if they were set by the task, so that they can be used later in the project.

Docs.summary: Whether or not to use UTF8 encoding for the cmd file and console window. Values: Always, Never, Detect If set to Detect, the current code page will be used unless it cannot represent the Command string. In that case, UTF-8 is used.
